queue.tweet: US markets drift higher as AI names power gains; S&P 500 and Nasdaq hover near records, while the Dow lags on energy/financials. Week ahead centers on the FOMC meeting (Sep 16–17); inflation data and earnings guidance will shape sentiment.
queue.summary:
Recent action shows AI-led momentum lifting the S&P 500 and Nasdaq toward record levels, with the Dow showing more muted gains. This leadership from mega-cap tech and AI plays remains a primary driver. 

What to watch: rate paths, inflation signals, and ongoing earnings guidance will steer risk sentiment as markets reassess valuations. 

Week ahead: the Fed meets Sep 16–17, with the SEP projections and policy tone closely watched; data on inflation and consumer demand will influence expectations for policy and markets.

queue.tweet: SPY options idea: bull call spread expiring Sep 19, 2025. Buy 650 strike call, sell 660 strike call. Net debit ~$3.31. Break-even ~$653.31. Max profit ~$6.69 if SPY ends at/above 660.
queue.summary:
Idea: use a defined-risk bull call spread on SPY with near-term expiry to capture a rally toward the 660 area. 

Trade details: long 650 call + short 660 call, net debit about 3.31; break-even around 653.31; max profit about 6.69 if SPY closes at/above 660 at expiration. 

Risks and guidance: if SPY stays below 650, the maximum loss is the net debit; liquidity and spreads should be checked in the direct option chain and adjusted as needed based on price action and IV.
